markdownRemark.excerpt: What’s the point? I realized something today. All this extra learning with programming, learning how to make screen prints (), making iOS…
markdownRemark.html:
What’s the point?

I realized something today. All this extra learning with programming, learning how to make screen prints (), making iOS apps, fiddling with options, learning new programming languages and paradigms, it’s all a waste of time! It’s just too much effort, and what do I get? Self satisfaction? More job opportunities? A daily challenge? I hate all those things!

I’m just gonna get my snug 40 hour a week job, and call it a day. No more development, just build a house and work that 9-5 for the rest of my days. You win life. I’m out.

In light of this lifestyle change,

I won’t be making any more Skillshare videos, any more art prints, or programming a single line ever again.

Sorry if I’ve offended you, but there’s even better news:

this is an April fool’s post. 😂

Oh, it’s also my birthday (NOT an april fools joke = trust me I’ve heard that one just a few times 😉).

I’m 27. And old. 💀

🍺 Cheers!

-Chris

frontmatter.title: I quit learning, writing, and being a creative.
Using a Fluent Interface to Ease The Pain of SOAP Calls
